Febnixary 27, 1962
Mr. Richard B. Hull
Telecommunications Center
The Ohio State University
2470 North Star Road
Columbus 21, Ohio
Dear Dick:
Re your letter of February 22nd, let's try to get together with
Jim for lunch on Sunday at 1 P.M. If you cannot make it that soon,
you may be able to get in for coffee and dessert. If not, we will
get together as soon as we can that afternoon, because there is a
cocktail hour at 5.
I have asked Jim (after Harry declined because of commitment to
his new book) to serve as chairman of our new Planning Committee.
This will be a committee composed partly of members of the Board and
partly of our more experienced "people at large." It will assume
some of the aspects of the old Development and Fund Raising Committees
but having a larger purpose in developing long-range planning. Its
immediate concern will be the preparation of the restructuring plan.
Since there is much to discuss on this latter score, I plan to
visit Jim in advance of the Region III meeting so that we can have
something pretty well in shape before we get together with you.
I had a good two-hour session with Lyle Nelson and it was well-
timed: he was just putting the final touches on his report to Ford.
We were in agreement on a substantial number of points concerning the
future of educational television and I was particularly gratified to
find that he believes that the next big area of development must relate
to people} furthermore, he feels NABB is the logical organization to do
this. He believes that after this evaluation by Ford, and their decision,
the air will be cleared considerably. Ford will make clear the precise
nature of support they will provide for ETB, thus leaving the way
clear for other foundations to enter the field.
We had a good talk and I came away feeling quite encouraged as
the result. Not all of Nelson's recommendations will be accepted,
of course, but if a substantial number are, I think prospects are
much improved for enhancing our activities.
